intro: Bowlesia setigera, commonly known as the hairy bowlesia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with four to five petals. Bowlesia setigera is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions.
